page.title: 12Loughor Castle.
page.content: After the Norman Conqust in 1066,the Normans built a series of castles in Wales.These were to help them rule the people.Many of these were built on the site of an old Roman fort.One of these castles was at Loughor where the Romans had built a large fort to guard the river crossing,and the ferry which gave access to the Gower from the West.The Norman castle was built by Henry Beaumont,First Earl of Warwick in 1099. All that remains of the castle today is the mound or rise in the ground and what appears to be the outside of a tower.A lot of work has been carried out on the ruins of the castle before it is cleared for a new road to be built.Many things have been found such as coins,jugs,cups and rings.These ancient finds help us to understand Norman life in our area.
